alert.note: Alert for Big Horn; Carbon; Golden Valley; Musselshell; Park; Stillwater; Sweet Grass; Wheatland; Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 10 at 3:42AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Warmest temperatures of the season bring high river flows... The warmest temperatures of the season will enhance snowmelt in the mountains, resulting in high and increasing flows on area waterways. Snow monitoring sites in the high country have shown increasing snow melt, and warming snowpack temperatures, increasing the potential for a rapid snowmelt. Showers and thunderstorms may add additional water to already high streams. While flooding is not imminent, many waterways are forecast to be close to bankfull by Monday. Runoff in the foothills may fill culverts, ditches, and storm drains causing water to flow over roadways potentially causing damage. Do not drive over flooded roadways, Turn Around Don`t Drown. Those with interests along area waterways should be prepared for high water levels and move property and livestock away from rivers, streams, and low lying areas. Bank erosion will make shorelines unstable. Do not walk near stream banks as the underlying soil may be eroded. Do not allow children to play near the water`s edge. Recreationists in the mountains and foothills should be prepared for changing conditions and use extra caution when near waterways. Flows will be fast, and the water is cold. Now is a dangerous time to be floating area rivers and streams with many hazards, some obscured by the silted water. Please wear a life vest if you must be on or near the water. Stay tuned to the forecast. Please report any flooding to local law enforcement and have them relay the report to the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Big Horn; Carbon; Golden Valley; Musselshell; Park; Stillwater; Sweet Grass; Wheatland; Yellowstone
